text:
It would be useful if there could be a flag to set in the build.properties that
would toggle between building lenya for development or production. The
differences  would be setting all the optimisations necessary for each situation
(.e.g perhaps memory / sitemap reloading etc)

So, for example, "./build.sh" by default builds lenya in "development" mode but
maybe "./build.sh production" would enable all opimisations suitable for a
production deployment.
creator: ps@nomensa.com

text:
can you put together a list of settings that you'd like in such a switch. i also
think this should be a build property rather than a seperate target.
creator: gregor@apache.org
ps@nomensa.com
text:
Picking items from the lenya wiki and from cocoon info

# turn off reloading of subsitemaps
# switch off reloading of flowscripts in cocoon.xconf

http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/Performance
http://cocoon.apache.org/2.1/performancetips.html
http://wiki.apache.org/cocoon/CocoonPerformance

Perhaps some predefined memory configs for common setups.

creator: jwkaltz@apache.org
text:
more things to differentiate:
- logging configuration (for example debug level in dev, error in prod)
- custom error page (Cocoon default in dev, encapsulation in prod)

one more: differentiate javac compile options.
Notably, debug should be off for production
creator: jwkaltz@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text: this is a very good idea. we should try to work on that early in the 1.4.1 cycle.
